alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 7:55PM CDT until May 13 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 200 AM CDT Saturday. * At 755 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Severy, Fall River, Climax, Fall River Lake, Fall River State Park, Cross Timbers State Park and Toronto Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
